p:
The received limonene was analyzed on a polarimeter PERKIN ELMER 341 (Hopkinton, MA, USA) in order to measure its optical rotation. The sample diluted in DCM at a concentration of 0.3 g/100 mL revealed an observed rotation of −0.29. The specific rotation
[ α ]
20 D
was calculated according to the formula:
[ α ]
20 D
= β * 100/μ * d (were β: the observed rotation, μ: cell length in dm and d: sample concentration in g/100 mL) at 20 °C and was found to be −96.
